text:
MINOs -- Moderates in Name Only -- have a clear choice these next few weeks. Will they empower extremists or will they join Democrats in funding the government and put people over politics?
politico.com/live-updates/20…

.@POTUS is canceling an additional $9 billion in student loan debt for nearly 125,000 borrowers, a powerful step to lesson the burden of student loans for borrowers as repayments begin. nytimes.com/2023/10/04/us/po…

Kevin McCarthy has proven himself to be a bad-faith negotiator, a person who breaks his commitments, and a person willing to do anything to stay in power, including empower right-wing extremists. I could not in good conscience vote to keep him as Speaker of the House.

By backing Kevin McCarthy in the MTV, @HouseGOP MINOs (Moderates in Name Only) are endorsing his approach to leadership and have become extremists themselves. They've voted for extreme bills, empowered this fantasy appropriations process, and wholly bought into the chaos.

Laphonza Butler’s appointment to complete the term of Senator Feinstein has cemented this seat for trailblazers and history makers. I look forward to working with her to solve the challenges facing California and our country.

As the first out person of color to serve in Congress, I am thrilled that Californians and all queer people of color have in Laphonza Butler a leader that can speak and legislate to the experiences of our community.
Let us all embrace the beauty of our diverse stories, struggles, and triumphs this #LGBTQHistoryMonth, and honor those who paved the way and continue the fight for equality.

Autoworkers have historically paved the way for changes to the workweek.  

The demand that @UAW is currently making at the bargaining table is legitimizing the idea of four-day workweek.

Veterans who left active duty between 9/11/01 and 10/1/13: you may be eligible for VA healthcare under my PACT Act.

The deadline to apply is this TODAY, Sept. 30. Visit VA.gov/PACT.
Tomorrow, on October 1st, borrowers are expected to restart payments on student loans. Find the best repayment program for you. studentaid.gov/manage-loans/…

It was great to see Chancellor Wilcox in DC this week. Congratulations to @UCRiverside for earning the Seal of Excelencia certification in recognition of their efforts to ensure Latino success in higher education!
Veterans have until tomorrow at midnight to take advantage of this special enrollment period.
With less than 33 hours until a shutdown, @HouseGOP must take up the Senate’s clean CR and do their duty to fund the government.
My statement on the passing of Senator Dianne Feinstein. takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…
We have lost a true legislative powerhouse who worked to uplift people throughout our state, nation, and the world. I send my sympathies to Sen. Feinstein's family, friends, and staff.
From her leadership in San Fransisco to her 30-year career to the Senate, Sen. Feinstein blazed a path for women in politics at the highest level, inspiring generations.
My office has studied the impacts of manufacturing and transportation across the 39th District. Read the full report here: takano.house.gov/imo/media/d…

Counties within the IE have some of the worst air quality in the country, directly affecting the health of our community. @SouthCoastAQMD is taking critical action to hold warehouses that have refused to comply with emission reduction efforts accountable. pressenterprise.com/2023/09/…

Thanks to the Biden-Harris Administration, if you owe student loans and make under $15 an hour, you may not have to pay student loan payments by this upcoming October 1 deadline. 

Make sure to check out and apply to the SAVE plan at studentaid.gov/announcements…

.@SenatorTimScott: The four-day workweek is not a punchline, it's a serious proposal to reimagine the workweek for the 21st century. We need leaders who aren't afraid to advocate for innovative ideas that will improve the work-life balance of all workers. themessenger.com/politics/se…

As the clock ticks down to the end of the fiscal year, @SpeakerMcCarthy is playing the dangerous game of appeasing far-right extremists. A MAGA government shutdown would disrupt the lives of millions.

Today, we’re all living under nearly a 100-year-old, arbitrary 40-hour workweek. 

It’s time to seriously consider my Thirty-Two Hour Workweek Act and bring labor standards into the 21st century. 8/8

As a former public-school educator, I know how strenuous the weekly workload is for teachers serving our children. Hundreds of school districts have shifted to a four-day school week so that teachers have enough time to recharge and avoid burnout. 7/8  pbs.org/newshour/education/m…
State legislatures are taking up measures to implement a four-day workweek as well, the most recent being introduced in Pennsylvania by @RepRoniGreen. 6/8 phillyvoice.com/four-day-wor…

THIS IS HUGE NEWS! The workers that build our auto industry have always fought for progressive labor standards. In 1926, Ford became one of the first employers to adopt the 40-hour workweek – nearly a decade before the five-day workweek became law. 5/8 morningbrew.com/sidekick/sto…
The @UAW members currently striking are demanding a four-day workweek in their new contract. 4/8 axios.com/2023/09/25/uaw-4-d…

🚨100% of companies participating in the research will continue the four-day workweek and over half of all employees reported reduced anxiety and burnout. That’s 1-0-0 percent! 3/8 4dayweek.com/long-term-2023-…
.@4Day_Week released a new report showing the impact on businesses participating in a six-month trial across the United States and Canada. 2/8 fortune.com/2023/07/27/longt…

We need a 32-hour workweek to create time for family, rest, and personal growth.  
 
Pockets of our country are already enjoying a shortened workweek, and more Americans want in. 🧵 1/8

Destigmatizing HIV leads to more testing, treatment, and future eradication of HIV/AIDS. Congress must continue to prioritize access to PrEP and other proven treatments in stopping this disease. #NGMHAAD

Yesterday, I met with Gen Z activists deeply concerned about the potential government shutdown, access to safe abortions, and the rights of LGBTQI+ people. 

I am inspired by their advocacy and courage in sharing their stories.
Thanks to the Biden Administration, every household can now order four free COVID-19 tests right to your door. Order today: covid.gov/tests

@POTUS is taking historic action to address gun violence. 
Thanks to his Administration our communities will be safer. npr.org/2023/09/20/120071248…

My PACT Act secured a special enrollment period for post 9/11 combat veterans. 

Don't wait, enroll today. VA.gov/PACT

Today I'm standing in solidarity with @UAW.

A 32-Hour Workweek, fair wages, job security.

These are things all workers deserve.

Republicans have reneged on the budget deal struck this summer that would have averted a government shutdown. Now they are hurting veterans with a defense spending bill proposal that stands no chance of passing the Senate. 
This was not inevitable, this was a choice.
This is an important first step in creating a more just, equitable future for all servicemembers. Read more about my legislation here: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…

Today, on the 12th anniversary of the repeal of 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell,' I am reintroducing the Commission on Equity and Reconciliation in the Uniformed Services Act to examine the legacy of discriminatory policies towards LGBTQ servicemembers.

Earlier this year my COMPACT Act went into effect, allowing all veterans and former servicemembers to receive free, on demand emergency suicide care – regardless of VA enrollment status. 
Read more about how the COMPACT Act is delivering for veterans. usnews.com/news/health-news/…

Last week, I was honored as a @WWP Legislator of the Year. 
Thank you to the advocates, servicemembers, and colleagues who share my vision for a nation where all veterans are cared for and supported.

The establishment of these two centers are a testament to Val Verde's commitment to fostering lifelong learning and enhancing community well-being. I'm thrilled to see wrap-around services like this available to those in our community.
Recently, I toured Val Verde Unified School District's Adult Education Center and Laundry Facility with Superintendent Michael McCormick.
Read more here: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…

@SenSanders, you're right. Workers could have the chance to gain an enormous amount of freedom from increases in productivity in the workplace. My Thirty-Two Hour Workweek Act can start this conversation in Congress and answer the calls of workers across the country.

Today we celebrate the advancements in HIV & AIDS treatments so that all people can live longer, happier lives. We must continue the fight by funding critical programs like PEPFAR that save lives around the world. #NHAAD axios.com/2023/09/07/hiv-pep…

If you’re experiencing a mental health crisis, reaching out is the first step in receiving the help you need. Throughout #SuicidePreventionMonth I am dedicated to providing our veterans with all of the support, resources, and care they need. veteranscrisisline.net/find-…

I’d like to wish a happy Deaf Awareness Day to the Deaf Community of Riverside! This year’s DeaFestival is centered around the theme: A World Where Deaf People Can Sign Anywhere. 
Let’s do our part to make this hope a reality.
Happy Rosh Hashanah to all who celebrate!

On National POW/MIA Recognition Day, join me in remembering all service members who were held as prisoners of war, and those who have not yet made it home. They are not forgotten. Today is an earnest reminder of the cost of freedom.

¡Feliz Mes de la Herencia Hispana! Nuestra Comunidad is strong because of its diversity. This month, we celebrate the history and contributions of the Hispanic community in our community and across the nation. #HispanicHeritageMonth
Solidarity forever. #StandUpUAW

More and more people are rethinking their relationship with work, and the time they spend on the job. 

It's time to have full debate and consideration of my 32-Hour Workweek Act in Congress.
Thanks for highlighting my bill, George! The 32-Hour Workweek Act will reimagine labor standards for workers to fit our modern era -- it’s past time to make these commonsense changes.

My Thirty-Two Hour Workweek Act would answer the call of workers fighting for a shorter workweek - improving the quality of life and allowing room to live, play, and enjoy life more fully outside of work. npr.org/2023/09/11/119839408…

If you're a veteran who served in a combat zone and transitioned from active duty between Sept. 11, 2001, and Oct. 1, 2013, don't miss the Sept. 30 open enrollment deadline for VA healthcare under my PACT Act. Act now at VA.gov/PACT.
Congratulations to Tanya Bradsher on her confirmation as Deputy Secretary of @DeptVetAffairs . I look forward to working with her and @VetAffairsDems.

The scourge of gun violence continues to plague our nation. Proud to have joined my colleagues in urging the President to use all tools at his disposal to make our communities safer. cnn.com/2023/09/12/politics/…

Opening an impeachment inquiry in search for a problem is no way to lead, and no way to ensure the government is funded so that people can receive the services they rely on. I stand with @POTUS through this baseless attempt by Speaker McCarthy as he bows to @HouseGOP extremists.

#CA39 stands to gain cleaner air and a healthier environment if we ensure that @EPA implements the strongest clean trucks standards. 
Our robust transportation and warehouse industries need to put public health first and cut emissions.

I'm thrilled to see @riversidecagov secure $27M in funding for affordable housing and I applaud the city for its competitive application! I look forward to seeing the progress of this 150-unit project and Riverside's work to tackle pressing housing issues. ktla.com/news/local-news/riv…

Looking forward to visiting Cellar Door Bookstore for its grand re-opening. 
New research from @antiviolence shows how LGBTQ+ Safe Spaces, such as Cellar Door, are under attack, and we must #ProtectSafeSpaces.

22 years ago, the tragic events of 9/11 shook the nation and claimed the lives of thousands. Our nation’s grit and perseverance carried us in the days and months after the attacks. Only by standing together can we ensure that the lessons of 9/11 are not tarnished by intolerance.

Earlier this year, I reintroduced the Gun Violence Prevention Research Safety Act to give the CDC a boost in funding for gun violence prevention research. #GunViolencePreventionWeek

Read more about the Gun Violence Prevention Research Safety Act here: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…
As the school year begin, a record number of students are going to school four days a week! It's time for Congress to codify the four-day workweek. nbcnews.com/now/video/some-s…

Recently, I joined a group of 170 Members of Congress to urge the Supreme Court to keep firearms out of the hands of abusers. #GunViolencePreventionWeek Read the full letter here: supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/2…

Last year I was proud to vote for the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act. By giving the Department of Justice the authority to expand required background checks, this legislation is already saving lives in our community. #GunViolencePreventionWeek
The Air Force is taking a positive step to ensure that all servicemembers can receive the healthcare they need without being penalized for it. airforcetimes.com/news/your-…

It is welcome news that Hong Kong’s top court has ordered legal recognition for same sex partners. However, we must remain sober in light of what occurred with respect to Hong Kong’s Basic Law in 2020 and Beijing’s increasing intolerance of LGBTQ citizens.

I applaud the courage of Hong Kong’s jurists and their basic decency. This decision has enormous potential reach as Indo-Pacific governments grapple with extending equality to their LGBTQ citizens. cnn.com/2023/09/05/china/sam…

A four-day school week goes hand in hand with a four-day workweek.
School districts are able to prioritize student learning while at the same time respect the time of teachers. thehill.com/homenews/educati…

This Labor Day, we celebrate rising union activity & workers for their fight for safer working conditions and regulations. Grassroots momentum like this will also get my 32-Hour Workweek Act passed so that there is greater work-life balance and equity across industries. #LaborDay

I was honored to meet and get to know Bill Richardson when I ran for Congress in the 1990s. He made lasting contributions to our country as a Member, Governor, and diplomat. Our nation and the world is indebted to Bill for his tenacity and service. My condolences to his family.

My mother, Nancy Takano, was and continues to be a source of strength and purpose in my life. On what would be her 83rd birthday, I’m thinking of her vibrant spirit, the bright example she set, and the lessons she taught me.
Read my statement on the proposed rule here: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…

It is past time for labor standards to be updated to allow more workers to qualify for overtime. 
The inadequate Trump rule allows businesses to take advantage of employees and suppress wages. Thank you @ActSecJulieSu for your leadership in fighting for workers.

.@DeptVetAffairs purchases medication at nearly a 50% discount to secure the health of our veterans. 

Today's news of Medicaid negotiations beginning - made possibly by the Inflation Reduction Act - is a step in bringing relief to consumers following VA’s blueprint.

Democrats will keep fighting until drug companies stop price gouging medication that saves lives. 

Today's news is a major win for all Medicaid beneficiaries and everyone who relies on these 10 common prescriptions.
Students must feel safe in order to thrive. @AGRobBonta is making the right call by investigating this targeted attack on a small minority of students. apnews.com/article/californi…

Working with @POTUS to ensure every veteran receives the benefits they deserve has been a honor of a lifetime -- but the work is not done yet. 

Go to VA.gov/PACT to see if you qualify for enhanced benefits secured through my PACT Act.
Let us draw inspiration from Dr. King's courage as we continue our work for equality. And let us remain steadfast in our commitment to justice for all

Today, we reflect on the March on Washington and the guidance Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s dream bestowed upon the nation. As we commemorate 60 years since that momentous occasion, let us honor the activists who paved the way in our fight for a more just society.

Today we celebrate the passage of the 19th Amendment and #WomensEqualityDay. Access to the ballot box is critical to the fight for equity in this country -- but our work is far from over. I will continue to champion the rights of women in all aspects of life.
As #CA39 works to find solutions that address homelessness, I am proud to have delivered $1 million in federal funding to the city of Moreno Valley to boost their Homelessness to Work program.
We'll get this done!

The data is clear — workers and businesses thrive with a Thirty-Two Hour Workweek. 

That's why I introduced a bill in Congress to do just that. Read more here: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…
Read more about my legislation here:  takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…
I’m thrilled to see state legislators take the initiative to implement a four day workweek. It’s time for Congress to catch up and pass my Thirty-Two Hour Workweek Act!

The PACT Act is the most comprehensive legislation to date to treat toxic exposure as a cost of war. By removing the burden of proof from servicemembers, more veterans are receiving the care they need.

military.com/benefits/pact-a…

CA39: Next week, I’m hosting an immigration workshop with @CHIRLA to share information and provide assistance with citizenship applications.

⏰ August 26th, 9:00AM
📍Jurupa Unified School District Parent Center

RSVP: ImmigrationWorkshopMT.eventb…

Reducing monthly payments and putting money back in borrower's pockets is a winning formula to help alleviate the burden of student debt. 
Find out if you qualify: studentaid.gov/announcements…

This month we celebrate one year of the passage of my PACT Act, where more than 800,000 claims and counting have already been filed. 
I look forward to continuing to ensure that veterans and their families receive the benefits they have rightfully earned. va.gov/resources/the-pact-ac…
washingtonpost.com/nation/20…

I’m deeply saddened to learn of the death of Lauri Carleton, a loving and devoted ally to the LGBTQ community. Her murder is a horrific reminder of the very real danger of anti-LBGTQ rhetoric and sentiments. My condolences go to her family and the Lake Arrowhead community.
rivcoready.org/disaster-prep…

As #HurricaneHilary approaches, it's crucial to be prepared and heed guidance from local officials. Be sure to make a plan, update emergency contacts, and sign up for weather alerts to stay prepared. Constituents can learn more by following the resources below.

I support @POTUS’s⁩ efforts to strengthen alliances among liberal democracies in order to check authoritarian forces. Congratulations to President Biden, President Yoon, and Prime Minister Kishida for this historic achievement. reuters.com/world/us-south-k…

This afternoon I joined my colleagues to hear @POTUS speak to the success of the #InflationReductionAct. 

I am proud to support this administration's work to invest in America to achieve everything from climate justice to affordable healthcare.

One year ago today, President Biden signed the #InflationReductionAct – the single largest climate and clean energy investment in American history. 
I am proud to have supported this legislation which will provide cleaner, cheaper energy for all Americans.

Social Security just turned 88 years old! 
Our Social Security system is vital for #CA39 where nearly 100,000 residents receive benefits. Expanding Social Security benefits us all. #SocSec88

Today is the deadline to file for backdated benefits guaranteed through my PACT Act. Thanks to the leadership of @SecVetAffairs, this important deadline was extended to today to allow as many veterans as possible to apply for their enhanced benefits.
To any students who are being directly impacted -- you matter and you belong, just as you are. Visit the @TrevorProject for mental health resources and one-on-one support.

Teachers have a responsibility to protect their students, not put them in harms way. This policy is intolerant and does not prioritize student safety. 
pressenterprise.com/2023/08/…
My thoughts are with the families of the deceased and all in Maui and Hawai’i Islands experiencing the devastating and horrific wildfires. cbsnews.com/news/hawaii-wild…

Happening now: Zoom webinar with @4dayweek_global right now to discuss my 32-Hour Workweek Act! 

Join the conversation: ushr.zoomgov.com/webinar/reg…
Visit VA.gov/PACT or call 1-800-827-1000 to register your intent to file a claim by Monday, August 14th.
With more than 800,000 claims and counting already filed, I look forward to continuing to ensure that veterans and their families receive the benefits they have rightfully earned.

One year ago today, Congress sent to @POTUS’s desk the most comprehensive legislation to date to treat toxic exposure as a cost of war and ensure that all toxic-exposed veterans can access the care and benefits they’ve earned.

I’m so proud to have led the passage of the Honoring our PACT Act. 

Together, we delivered on our promise to veterans that their government will take care of them when they come home—no matter the cost.

Join me tomorrow evening at 5:30 PM for a Town Hall at Riverside City College Digital Library to share your thoughts, ask questions, and discuss important matters in our community and district. 

RSVP here: TOWNHALLRIV.eventbrite.com

The #CHIPSandScienceAct was signed one year ago today & communities across the country are already feeling the impacts of the Investing in America agenda through good paying jobs, inflation easing, and research and innovation. nbcnews.com/politics/white-h…
Thank you, @RepJasmine, for helping spread the word about my PACT Act!

I’m hosting a webinar with @4dayweekglobal this Thursday, August 10th to discuss my 32-Hour Workweek Act and recent 4 Day Week study data that confirmed previous positive findings about the benefits of a shortened workweek. Register:
events.humanitix.com/4-day-w…

As the author of the Honoring our PACT Act, I want as many veterans as possible to apply for their expanded benefits by Wednesday, August 9th. Watch my full interview with @Elex_Michaelson and apply today at VA.gov/PACT.

If you are a #CA39 resident struggling to access your PACT Act benefits, my office is here to help make sure our toxic-exposed veterans get the care they deserve! Visit Takano.house.gov to connect with my Riverside office or VA.gov/pact.

Join me on August 10th, 5:30 pm at Riverside City Colleges Digital Library to discuss top priorities and services for #CA39 constituents. Your thoughts and ideas are critical in shaping our community's future.

RSVP Here: TOWNHALLRIV.eventbrite.com

I am proud to fight for our veterans to ensure they receive the much-needed care they earned. I led the passage of the PACT Act to expand health care and benefits to veterans exposed to burn pits. Learn more about this law: VA.gov/pact

Last week I joined my colleagues to discuss the current state of transgender health and safety. 
As bigoted attacks against our community persist, it is crucial that we keep all parties informed and up to date on their rights. advocate.com/politics/congre…

Riverside County is home to one of the highest veteran populations nationwide, and my office is here to help make sure our veterans can access their PACT Act benefits. #CA39 residents can visit takano.house.gov or VA.gov/PACT.

Shinjiro Atae’s coming out is a powerful and courageous declaration of honesty and self-acceptance. Congratulations, Atae-San for your bravery and the inspiration you’ve brought to millions in Japan and across the world.
 nytimes.com/2023/07/26/world…

As we approach one year since the passage of my historic Honoring our PACT Act, I am committed to ensuring all our veterans and their families receive the benefits they deserve. File your claim here:  VA.gov/PACT

Did you know in addition to expanding benefits to toxic-exposed veterans, the PACT Act also expands benefits to their loved ones and surviving family members? Veterans, caregivers, and illness-loss survivors are encouraged to file for PACT Act benefits as soon as possible.

Today, we celebrate 70 years since the end of the Korean War and the beginning of a relationship between the United States and the Republic of Korea centered on our shared values of freedom, democracy, peace, and human rights.

I'm reintroducing a bill with @RepDonBeyer, @RepCasten, @RepBillFoster, and @SenatorLujan to bring back the Office of Technology Assessment (OTA), help Congress legislate proactively, and meet the tech advances of the future. 
Read our release: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…

If you have been exposed to a toxic substance during your military service, join @DeptVetAffairs Facebook live on August 2nd  at 3:30 EST to learn more about the benefits and healthcare you may be eligible for through my PACT Act.
news.va.gov/122258/va-vfw-vv…

New findings confirm that my #32HourWorkweekAct will improve the quality of life of and ensure fair pay for workers. It's time for Congress to give serious consideration to the #4DayWorkweek.

We must fight for our LGBTQI+ veterans, our female veterans, and all veterans just as they have fought for us, and focus our work on strengthening VA and the critical programs and resources it provides to our veterans.

.@HouseGOP attempts to attach extremist riders to the Milcon-VA funding bill at the expense of our veterans is a slap in the face to those who have served our nation. From stripping abortion access to cutting diversity efforts at @DeptVetAffairs, these policies are un-American.
Upcoming deadline: file your PACT Act claim by  August 9thto have your benefits backdated to August 10, 2022 if eligible. More info here ⬇️

A #4DayWeek benefits both workers and businesses, and we have the data to back it up. 
From increased efficiency to decreased burnout, today's report makes clear the positive impacts of a shortened week and the need to change our workweek standards with my #32HourWorkweekAct

Insurance companies shouldn't stand in the way of someone receiving mental healthcare. 
Thank you @POTUS for inviting me and my colleagues to the White House yesterday to hear more about increasing access to all Americans -- there is no healthcare without mental healthcare.
Today we celebrate the 75th anniversary of the desegregation of the Armed Forces. Watch my reflection below ⤵️

Congratulations @Teamsters on your historic agreement with UPS! Your tireless fight has shown us the power unions hold and what happens when workers stand together. This is a huge win for workers across the country.

Today is #NationalHireAVeteranDay! Every year, thousands of servicemembers leave the military & return to civilian life. Our veterans bring unique skills and experiences to the workplace, and we must support their return to work after serving our country. news.va.gov/122090/vre-suppo…

The instruction of LGBTQI+ history should never be denied or obscured from students. 
latimes.com/california/story…
My Honoring our PACT Act extends long-overdue care to over 3.5 million veterans living with the effects of toxic exposure. Veterans, secure your benefits today: VA.gov/PACT

This year's FAA reauthorization shows that we can legislate while keeping in mind the environmental, safety, and technological needs of America. Read my full statement here.

Thank you for attending!

Thrilled to welcome @RAMriverside @thecheechcenter to DC in celebration of their 2023 National Medal for Museum and Library Service!

My Republican colleagues on @HouseVetAffairs are inserting divisive politics and disinformation into the very real and serious topic of veteran suicide by firearm. 

Watch my full remarks at today’s Legislative Hearing here: piped.video/live/z3cJLIJ92pc…

It was a pleasure to convene VSO leaders w/@RepJeffries at yesterday's roundtable. With the filing deadline for backdated benefits guaranteed through my PACT Act approaching next month, it was critical to hear from VSOs directly about implementation and expanding awareness.
Veterans, if you were exposed to toxic substances during your service, you may be eligible for extra benefits under my PACT Act. There is no deadline or fee to a claim file! Visit VA.gov/PACT.

My office is hosting a Grants Workshop with @HUDgov at Riverside City College this Thursday. Gain valuable insights, practical tips, and network with professionals in the field. Sign up here!

If you or someone you know is in crisis or seeking support, call or text 988 to speak with a counselor. 
To access the Veterans Crisis Line: Dial 988+1 or text 838255.
To access the lifeline for Deaf & Hard of Hearing users: Use your preferred relay service or dial 711 then 988.

Last year, the #988Lifeline and #VeteransCrisisLine were launched to ensure all Americans can access 24/7 mental health support at no cost. These programs are critical in strengthening our crisis care response system and getting those in crisis the help they need.

While the NDAA is intended to strengthen our military & defense operations, this traditionally bipartisan bill was co-opted by MAGA Republicans this year to attack diversity efforts within our military, restrict access to reproductive healthcare, & advance their divisive agenda.

I applaud the Biden Administration’s commitment to student debt forgiveness, despite the Supreme Court’s efforts to rip away desperately needed relief from millions of borrowers. We must continue to fight for student loan borrowers and get them the relief they deserve.

This week, I sat down with @JohnQABC to discuss my Veteran Service Recognition Act and the importance of this legislation to support our noncitizen veterans, who face deportation despite putting their lives on the line to fight for our country. 
abcnews.go.com/US/citizen-ve…

Today, @US_FDA approved the first over-the-counter birth control pill. This is a huge win for reproductive freedom, providing accessible contraception nationwide—regardless of age or healthcare access.

Join my Grant Writing 101 Workshop in collaboration with @HUDgov & Riverside Community College! Gain valuable insights and network with professionals in the field. 

🗓️ July 20, 2023 • 10AM PST

Temperatures continue to rise in Southern California as we face an extreme heat wave throughout the region this week.🔥
Find Riverside County cooling centers and tips to stay safe and beat the heat here: riversideca.gov/readyriversi…
Read my press release here: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…

The notion of a deported veteran is one that offends many Americans' sense of fairness. As we just celebrated the founding of our nation on July 4th, I am incredibly proud to reintroduce the Veteran Service Recognition Act to support our noncitizen service members.

Congressional and executive action has resulted in lower consumer prices for Americans. 

The evidence is clear: Democrats are delivering for the middle class.

PSA:📣This year, California returned to its pre-COVID Medicaid and CHIPS enrollment policies – meaning that if you use Medicaid, you need to confirm your coverage eligibility once a year. Visit KeepMediCalCoverage.org or call my district office at 951-222-0203 for help.

I was proud to introduce and pass the Korean American VALOR Act in the House that would extend VA healthcare to naturalized citizens who served alongside the United States. forbes.com/sites/ronakdesai/…
Happy 4th of July! Let us unite in celebration of the ideals that we strive to actualize in this nation: freedom, equality, and justice for all. Wishing you a safe and joyous celebration!

I'm joining @ryanobles shortly to discuss the recent Supreme Court decisions.

Watch below⤵️

This radical Court continues to demonstrate its unwillingness to rule in line with democratic values or the will of the American people. 

We must expand the Supreme Court immediately.

The Supreme Court’s decision to allow anti-LGBTQI+ discrimination under the guise of ‘free speech’ in the 303 Creative v. Elenis decision is horrifying and stunning. Today’s harmful decision opens the door for unimaginable legal discrimination against marginalized people.

The Supreme Court has ruled to strike down President Biden’s student loan forgiveness program, ripping desperately needed relief from student loan borrowers just 24 hours after the Court ruled to nullify affirmative action. Abominable.

This proposed budget is a gimmick to try and change the conversation after @HouseGOP’s disastrous $2 billion clawback of veterans’ healthcare in the Default on America Act. Veterans and their families should not be fooled.

All of this comes at a crucial time as VA has just begun implementing my PACT Act, and under this Republican proposal VA will have far less funding than is necessary to deliver the long overdue benefits provided by the law.
Let’s be clear: a cut to other federal agencies will put more of a burden on VA and will impact the services it can provide veterans.
Republicans have to find the cuts they voted for somewhere, and that will be cuts for homeless veterans, low-income veterans and their families, children, older Americans, and many others.
Moreover, while their proposed budget provides bare minimum funding to VA, we are bracing for a significant cut to services that veterans rely on, like SNAP, housing vouchers, and child care.
This $14.7 billion shortfall could force VA to rob funds from other veteran programs in order to successfully implement my PACT Act.

House Republicans have shortchanged the Toxic Exposure Fund. Republicans have removed protections for funding dedicated to toxic-exposed veterans and have gone further, providing only $5.5 billion of the Administration’s $20.3 billion budget request.
After many months of evasion, House Republicans have finally unveiled their plan for our nation’s veterans – and it isn’t nearly good enough. 🧵
Together, we will continue to write the next chapter of our shared history and strive for a future where diversity is celebrated, justice is achieved, and every voice is heard.

The budget House Republicans passed last week makes their values clear: they are reneging on their promise to veterans, holding veterans' benefits hostage, and ultimately seeking to balance the budget on the backs of veterans – no matter the consequences.

🚩Increase wait times for benefits like pensions, life insurance, GI bill education supports, & employment services.
🚩Limit VA’s delivery of telehealth services.
🚩Slash funding for critical VA hospital & clinic upgrades, negatively impacting veterans’ access to care.

🚩 Reduce access to outpatient care at VA medical facilities by 30 million visits.
🚩Eliminate funding for housing vouchers for up to 50,000 homeless veterans.
🚩Cut 81,000 jobs from the Veterans Health Administration.
🚩Despite their rhetoric that veterans would be protected, the budget plan passed by @HouseGOP  FAILED to ensure across-the-board cuts wouldn't harm veterans. The Republicans’ 22% budget cut would:

As Ranking Member of @VetAffairsDems, I can tell you the truth is that @HouseGOP's "Default on America Act" will bring longer wait times for disability claims, fewer medical visits, and an overall downgrade in veteran health services. 🧵
Every worker deserves a union. As a member of @USProgressives, I am a proud supporter of union power and collective bargaining to achieve fair pay, benefits, and dignity for their workers.
.@HouseGOP: show me where the bill you passed last week DOESN'T cut funding for veterans by 22%. I'll wait.

2023 marks the 70th anniversary of our alliance, and it is far past time for our nation to properly honor the service of Korean American veterans who served side-by-side with U.S. troops. These veterans should not have to wait any longer for the respect and VA care they deserve.
Yesterday’s joint address from President Yoon Suk Yeol was a further reminder of the deep relationship between the United States and Republic of Korea.

Today’s passage of my bill is another critical step to bring parity for Korean American Vietnam veterans who have never been eligible for the VA healthcare services that they earned. I’m happy to have continued bipartisan support and I look forward to a vote on the House floor.

Today, my Korean American VALOR Act passed out of @HouseVetAffairs. The VALOR Act would expand the eligibility of benefits to veterans who served in the armed forces of the Republic of Korea during the Vietnam War and have since become naturalized U.S. citizens.
.@HouseGOP are seeking to balance the federal budget on the backs of veterans — not on my watch.
With the #DefaultOnAmerica Act, Republicans have shown the American people that they are unwilling to be responsible stewards of our economy or allies to our veterans.

Joshua Jacobs is a proven partner, helping to implement provisions of my Honoring our PACT Act. Now confirmed by the Senate, I look forward to working with Mr. Jacobs and @VAVetBenefits to protect funding and preserve the programs that will help veterans lead meaningful lives.

As Ranking Member of @VetAffairsDems, I’ll join @SpeakerPelosi, @RepBrownley @RepDeluzio and @votevets at a press conference today at 4:30 EST to push back on these proposed cuts that harm our nation’s veterans.

Like their fellow Americans, active-duty servicemembers, veterans, and their families may go hungry and lose access to healthcare if @HouseGOP get their wish on this proposal. To honor the pact we made with our nation’s servicemembers, we must protect the programs they rely on.

The budget “caps” proposed by @HouseGOP fail to ensure veterans and servicemembers won’t be harmed by across-the-board cuts. Instead, this non-serious proposal puts veterans' care and benefits at risk, pitting veterans programs against the rest of the American people.

I'm honored to have Richard Valdez join me as my guest to this year's State of the Union address. Richard’s advocacy was instrumental in my efforts while I was Chair of @VetAffairsDems to pass the Honoring our PACT Act. Meet Richard: piped.video/watch?v=z4OjLV8a…

As Japan & the US strengthen ties, we must remember the common democratic values that motivate our alliance. Authoritarians are hostile to LGBT+ rights. I commend PM Kishida for acting consistent to these values by dismissing a senior advisor for his hurtful homophobic remarks.
I won't stand for @HouseGOP attempts to destroy some of our most cherished social safety net programs by conflating them with so-called “socialism."

To exclude @Ilhan from the committee would be to close our ears and harden our hearts against the millions of people facing the same challenges today. We must keep @Ilhan on the committee where she so ably serves, and focus our work on the real needs of our country.
Representative @Ilhan brings an essential perspective to the Foreign Affairs Cmte, as someone who has seen the violence of war up close and had to navigate the often-unjust refugee system.

This #BlackHistoryMonth, we come together to honor and recognize the achievements of Black Americans in Riverside and across the nation. Although we’ve taken monumental steps toward justice and equality, we must remain vigilant and active in the fight to end systemic racism.

Bolsonaro must go home. 

The United States will not be a refuge for would-be autocrats.

I’m proud to reintroduce long-overdue legislation honoring civil rights icon Fred Korematsu on his birthday with @RepJillTokuda, @maziehirono, and @SenDuckworth. Fred’s legacy reminds us that we must continue to protect the basic human rights of all marginalized groups.

I sat down with @ASP yesterday to discuss how my bill with @RepBonamici would help eligible students access nutrition assistance programs. 

A student’s focus should be getting a quality education, not stressing over where their next meal will come from.
Last week was my first District Work Period of the year! Check out my latest "Mark On The Move" episode to see exciting things happening in California's 39th Congressional District.

I'm thrilled to welcome the @VetAffairsDems  members who will serve on the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs for the 118th Congress!
Looking forward as always to joining @MasonMornings LIVE in a few moments!
I send my condolences to the entire Half Moon Bay community, which is feeling unimaginable pain in the aftermath of a mass shooting. This is a heartbreaking time for California.

My thoughts remain with the families of victims and survivors as we mourn the incomprehensible tragedy in Monterey Park. We must find the morale, courage, and political will to end senseless gun violence in our country.
I’m going LIVE with @donlemon on @CNNThisMorning momentarily to discuss the devastating mass shooting in Monterey Park, California.

50 years ago today, the #RoevWade decision recognized the constitutional right to abortion, but last year, the extreme Supreme Court stripped that right. I will continue to fight to ensure that everyone has the freedom to control their body, and access to safe abortion care.

I am devastated to learn of the Monterey Park shooting on the eve of the Lunar New Year, and send my condolences to the families of those killed or injured.

Our AAPI community deserves to celebrate without fear of violence.

I’m disheartened to learn of the eviction notice for Cellar Door Books and its potential connection to the hosting of Drag Queen Story hour. Linda, the owner, has long been an ardent supporter of our LGBTQ+ community, and these story hours are enriching spaces for all.
I am proud to be a member of the LGBTQI+ community, and a Co-Chair of the @LGBTEqCaucus again in the 118th Congress!
CA-39: Join me this evening, 6:00PM PST at Bob Glass Gym in Perris for our first Town Hall Meeting of the year! RSVP at perristownhall.eventbrite.co….

I'm thrilled by @WhiteHouse's unveiling of the National Strategy to Advance Equity, Justice, and Opportunity for AA and NHPI Communities, and @POTUS's continued commitment to and advocacy for our community. I look forward to the work ahead.

My condolences to the family of Deputy Darnell Calhoun and the Riverside County Sheriff's Department during this challenging time. We mourn Deputies Calhoun and Cordero, two deputies tragically killed in the last three weeks. We must act to prevent this senseless violence.
HUGE NEWS: beginning today, veterans can receive no-cost emergency mental health care at VA or non-VA healthcare facilities thanks to my COMPACT Act.

This Korean American Day, I'm proud to reintroduce the bipartisan Korean American VALOR Act to ensure that the Korean American Vietnam Veterans who fought alongside American forces can get the VA healthcare that they deserve. Read my release: takano.house.gov/newsroom/pr…

Join me for my first Town Hall Meeting of 2023 next January 18th, 6:00 PM PST at Bob Glass Gym in Perris, CA. You'll have the opportunity to hear from myself and my District Staff about the services we offer to the constituents of #CA39.

Two days ago, we marked the 2 year anniversary of the 6th insurrection. Anti-democratic violence in Brazil today is a sobering reminder of the dangerous fascist movements growing across the world. Jair Bolsonaro should not be allowed refuge in the US.

The election of Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva to the Brazilian presidency was free, fair, and credible. The United States and democratic people everywhere must continue to stand by the results of this election.

This news report answers the question I asked last night: what did Kevin McCarthy bargain away to get the collaboration of extremists?

Answer? He became one himself.

It is an immense privilege to represent California’s 39th District and serve my home community in Congress. Riverside has an advocate in me, and I will continue serving my constituents with dedication and commitment!

What did McCarthy promise to get the collaboration of extremists?
 
The future of Social Security and Medicare? Our nation’s full faith and credit? Keeping our gov’t open?

What is certain is that Americans will suffer greatly from the GOP's irresponsibility and incompetence.
